ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Excellent. It feels odd to gush about a course on genocide, but this seminar was truly excellent.
I would definitely recommend the course
Yes I would recommend the course to others

I would recommend the course for those unexposed to the study of violence or to comparative history. HIST 980 is a sweeping comparative-historical survey of worldwide instances of genocide and its theory. The course also couples with Yale's Genocide Studies Program, exposing students to current work in the field -- both academic and non-academic work.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Though the course did not directly impact my dissertation research it very deeply indirectly impacted my dissertation research by encouraging me to think more theoretically about violence. The course very greatly deepened my knowledge of Genocide Studies and the historical profession.
